visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chart with the following specifications: Chart type: spline, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#003366) for the title and labels, with a font size of 14px for the title and 12px for the labels, Data series: Include two series named 'Reggane' and 'Tallinn' with their respective monthly temperature data, Custom colors: Use a gradient from blue to green for the 'Reggane' series and a gradient from red to yellow for the 'Tallinn' series, Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color (#f2f2f2), add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50px on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a spline chart titled 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The chart includes two data series, 'Reggane' and 'Tallinn', each representing the average temperature for each month of the year. The chart's background is set to a light gray color, and the margins are adjusted to 50px on all sides for better spacing. The title and axis labels are styled with a dark blue color and specific font sizes for readability. The legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart for easy access to series information. Additionally, custom color gradients are applied to each series: a blue-to-green gradient for 'Reggane' and a red-to-yellow gradient for 'Tallinn', enhancing the visual distinction between the two datasets.
